level.heading: NOTICE OF DENIAL, REVOCATION OR SUSPENSION (ยง 30-210)

level.text: If the Board initially votes to deny an original or a renewal license, or to revoke or suspend an agent’s license, the Agency shall send a written notice by certified mail, return receipt requested, stating the following:
The reasons for denial, revocation or suspension;
The right to contest the denial, revocation or suspension at a hearing before the Agency; and
The right to be represented by counsel or any other person.

In order to request a hearing, the applicant or agent shall file a written request for a hearing with the Executive Director within fifteen (15) business days of the receipt of the notice in accordance with the provisions of Chapter 4 of this title.
The Executive Director shall set a date, time, and place for the hearing and shall provide notice to the applicant or agent at least fifteen (15) days prior to the hearing.
The Board’s action shall be final if one of the following occurs:
An applicant or agent fails to file a written request for a hearing within fifteen (15) business days after receipt of the notice; or
After a hearing, the Board affirms its initial decision.
Upon notification of the final decision by the Board to deny a renewal license, the agent shall do the following:
Cease the sale of lottery tickets;
Render a final lottery accounting by the date on the order; and
Surrender the license, identification card, on-line computer terminal, and any other lottery property to the Agency by the date on the order.

level.heading: HISTORICAL NOTE
level.text: Prior to December 29, 1989, the D.C. Lottery and Charitable Games Control Board published Final Rulemaking published at 29 DCR 2202 (May 28, 1982).
